title.narrative: Percentage of women and youth who have applied for formal financial services (either successful or not)

comment.narrative: Baseline value as in the external baseline report with the targeted communities as a sample. We will monitor the percentage of women and youth in VSLAs who have applied for formal financial services but estimate the baseline value in the external representative.

419 women out of 16.803 used formal financial services. These are all VSLA members, our direct target group. Althought the baseline of 9,7% informed a broader representation of the target communities, we are now following the percentage within our target group. The midterm will look at the wider community.

title.narrative: Percentage of women and youth who have applied for formal financial services (either successful or not)

comment.narrative: Baseline value as in the external baseline report with the targeted communities as a sample. We will monitor the percentage of women and youth in VSLAs who have applied for formal financial services but estimate the baseline value in the external representative.
No data collected yet, this is the baseline value

title.narrative: Number of banks / cooperatives or microfinance institutions that have a working linkage with the VSLAs in each intervention zone of the project

comment.narrative: Identification of baseline value is ongoing (delayed because of COVID19)
Target value will be based on the baseline value and added during the second semester

1 cooperative was found to already work with VSLAs by providing loans to VSLA members. This data is generated by the advocacy teams research to collect evidence for our advocacy axis aiming at adapted finacial services and products that are accessible for women and youth entrepreneurs.

title.narrative: Number of banks / cooperatives or microfinance institutions that propose accessible financial products (= conditions that can actually be fulfilled by the target groups) to youth and women in each intervention zone of the project

comment.narrative: Identification of baseline value is ongoing (delayed because of COVID19)
Target value will be based on the baseline value and added during the second semester

From the same research to inform our advocacy agenda, 10 financial institutions do already provide financial services and products that are accessible to women and youth entrepreneurs (VSLA members in our programme), as can be seen in the former indicator, only 1 of those institutions actually has a link with VSLAs

title.narrative: Number of banks / cooperatives or microfinance institutions that have a working linkage with the VSLAs in each intervention zone of the project

comment.narrative: Identification of baseline value is ongoing (delayed because of COVID19)
Target value will be based on the baseline value and added during the second semester

title.narrative: Number of women and youth (boys and girls) organised into VSLAs (disaggregate by new and already existing VSLAs)

comment.narrative: The baseline value for women and youth in new VSLAs is 0, the baseline value of existing VSLAs is 27000
27000 women and girls in already existing VSLAs, 12500 women and 5000 youth in new VSLAs
107 men, 3654 women, 620 girls et 3 boys.

title.narrative: Number of women and youth (boys and girls) organised into VSLAs (disaggregate by new and already existing VSLAs)

comment.narrative: The baseline value for women and youth in new VSLAs is 0, the baseline value of existing VSLAs is 27000
27000 women and girls in already existing VSLAs, 12500 women and 5000 youth in new VSLAs

12.526 women and girls were organized in VSLAs during the second semester. Over the first semester, 107 men were reported whereas they are not included in this indicator so the cumulative number is corrected for this error, giving a total of 16803 women & youth (girls and boys) organized in VSLAs

title.narrative: Percentage of women and youth who are active users of financial services (disaggregated by informal and formal services) on their own name

comment.narrative: This indicator has been captured by the external baseline report where the sample was based on the targeted communities, and will be captured again during the midterm and endline evaluation. In IATI we will report the number and percentage of women and youth in VSLAs (key target group). Baseline data (looking at the percentage of women and youth that are active users of financial services when they enter new VSLAs) will be captured during the second semester of the programme.
Internal target value to be determined

100% using informal services (within VSLAs) and 2,5% formal services (these are people using both informal and formal services). There are thus far no women and girls exclusively using formal services because the target groups are all organized in VSLAs.

title.narrative: Percentage of women and youth who are active users of financial services (disaggregated by informal and formal services) on their own name

comment.narrative: This indicator has been captured by the external baseline report where the sample was based on the targeted communities, and will be captured again during the midterm and endline evaluation. In IATI we will report the number and percentage of women and youth in VSLAs (key target group). Baseline data (looking at the percentage of women and youth that are active users of financial services when they enter new VSLAs) will be captured during the second semester of the programme.
Internal target value to be determined
No data collected yet, will be reported during the second semester

title.narrative: Percentage of women and youth who have received a loan to invest in their enterprise and have reimbursed

comment.narrative: This indicator will be monitored gradually within the target groups of the programme (VSLA members). The baseline value has not been well captured and can therefore not be used.

7922 loans (counting only new VSLAs) were provided, 70% of these loans were already reimbursed, and the remanent was still within the approved reimbursing dates, so we did not experience any 'failure' to reimburse yet,. The final/actual reimbursement rate is most probably higher than 70% and will be followed over time.

title.narrative: Percentage of women and youth who have received a loan to invest in their enterprise and have reimbursed

comment.narrative: This indicator will be monitored gradually within the target groups of the programme (VSLA members). The baseline value has not been well captured and can therefore not be used.
No data collected yet, will be reported during the second semester

title.narrative: Number of women and youth who are active users of financial services (disaggregated by informal and formal services) on their own name

comment.narrative: This indicator will be monitored gradually within the target groups of the programme (VSLA members).
Internal target value to be determined

During the second semester 12.526 women and girls were active users of financial services, these include both information (mainly linked to VSLAs) and formal services. Over the first semester, also 4.259 persons were active users, however, these were not captured yet during the first semester so directly added to the cumulative total of this indicator. This progress on this indicator is already at 235% compared to the annual target, this is because all financial services are included whereas in the beginning of the programme we had in mind these would only include credits/loans. Since thus far (and also in general) all VSLA members do make use of financial services within VSLAs, the total number of people organized in VSLAs are reported here. However, if we distinguish between formal and informal services, we identify that 100% of users use informal services and only 2,4% using formal services (while still using informal services at the same time).

title.narrative: Number of women and youth who are active users of financial services (disaggregated by informal and formal services) on their own name

comment.narrative: This indicator will be monitored gradually within the target groups of the programme (VSLA members).

title.narrative: Number of women and youth who have carried out a market study

comment.narrative: All woman and youth who started an entreprises

1335 new women and girls carried out a market study. This indicator is behind progress when looking at the annual target, due to reasons mentioned before (COVID-19). However, 105% of women and girls who actually started an enterprise did carry out a market study, meaning some already did a market study but did not yet start their enterprise.

title.narrative: Percentage of women and youth who have started an enterprise, among those who have received a training

comment.narrative: At least 30% of those who will follow the basic entrepreneuriat training
1335 women and youth started an enterprise among 6330 who received basic training within VSLAs

title.narrative: Percentage of women, boys and girls who have developed a business plan

comment.narrative: 30% of those who will follow the basic training (100% = all VSLA members within the programme)
14% of VSLA members developed their business plan (target is 30%)

title.narrative: Number of women, boys and girls who have developed a business plan

comment.narrative: All woman and youth who started an entreprises

Even though the basic entreprenurship training is still ongoing, we adapted to the COVID19 situation by already supporting 12 business plans (key activity:fabrication of masks). 11 businessplans are submitted by women and 1 by a girl

title.narrative: Number of women and adolescent girls who use modern contraceptives and reproductive health services

comment.narrative: Far beyond targeted number (229%). This indicator seems to be under estimated, at the start of the programme we thought there would be a lot of resistance, even though there is, through interventions linked to transforming social norms, women and girls become open to start using family planning services and commodities. Also, the additional activities supported by the Bennink Foundation accelerated the number of women and girls adhering to contraceptives.

title.narrative: Number of men and boys in the reflection groups who have finalised the training course on themes related to positive masculinity

comment.narrative: More men than initially targeted for this year have been organized in Reflexion Groups as result to implementing alternative measures to catch up the delay casused by COVID-19 restrictions

title.narrative: Number of health staff trained in family planning and gender based violence

comment.narrative: No new health staff trained, however, an error occurred in the first semester as actually 15 instead of 16 health staff were trained.

title.narrative: Percentage of women and girls who support the positive change in attitudes and behaviour or their husbands and their peers

comment.narrative: Not at the targeted % yet, social norms seem to be very persistant and hold women back to support changes in behaviour of their men (since this does not conform with existing gender norms)

title.narrative: Number of structures provided with SRH commodities

comment.narrative: Provision of SRHR commodities not yet started

title.narrative: Number of women and youth referred to specialized institutions

comment.narrative: Relatively little referrals have been realized, both because a little number of institutions can be found in Rwanda and borders have been closed, but also because many women and youth strengthening their skills among each other, instead of following formal trainings (which they might not be able to afford)

title.narrative: Number of women and adolescent girls who use modern contraceptives and reproductive health services

comment.narrative: The training within health centers took place in June, we have advocated for free provision of contraceptives. Data will be collected starting in the second semester.

title.narrative: Number of persons sensitized about family planning and GBV

comment.narrative: These are people sensitized by community health workers. The number is behind the target, which can be explained by the delay in training community health workers due to COVID-19 restrictions.

title.narrative: Number of women and youth who have finalised their entrepreneurship training

comment.narrative: All women and youth in targeted VSLAs will receive the basic training
These are women and girls who finalized the advanced entrepreneurship training

title.narrative: Number of women and youth who have started an enterprise, among those who have received a training

comment.narrative: At least 30% of those who will follow the basic entrepreneuriat training

This indicator is behind its annual target (at 33%), mainly because of COVID-19 restrictions which delayed the entrepreneurship trainings and made it more difficult to launch their business. Taking into account these challenges, results are still satisfactory

title.narrative: Number of women, boys and girls who have developed a business plan

comment.narrative: All woman and youth who started an entreprises

This indicator is behind its annual target (at 48%), mainly because of experienced COVID-19 restrictions which delayed the entrepreneurship trainings and many women and girls are still at the stage of developing their business plan

title.narrative: Number of persons sensitized about family planning and GBV

comment.narrative: This module has not been introduced yet, as VSLAs will first finalize the basic entrepreneurship training. The community networks will also sensitize on family planning and GBV, starting from the second semester

title.narrative: Number of men and boys in the reflection groups who have finalised the training course on themes related to positive masculinity

comment.narrative: Training has not yet started, facilitators will be trained from July onwards and 554 men and boys have already been selected to start the training

title.narrative: Number of men and boys "champions" who are engaged in the transformation of social norms
Percentage of men who don't accept violence

comment.narrative: Data will be collected once training has started

title.narrative: Percentage of men who don't accept violence

comment.narrative: Through the GEM scale tool, at the start of the training course for men & boys, 37% did not accept violence, compared to 96% at the beginning of the training course. Given this is theoretical information, it needs to be followed if this will be translate into reduced violence in practice.
